This movie is exciting, fun, and full of magic! It's different than other movies like this. Well there aren't other movies like this. Great story and good acting this movie makes magic seem interesting and fun again.

this movie is pretty good but its problem is that it is so forgettable does that make it a bad movie no but what's the point in making it so forgettable that  I can barely tell you what the pilot is. I know its not the people who made the film fault but it still is forgettable.

A fairly entertaining movie. It shows even more why Eisenberg can completely impress the world with his acting chops. But the cleverness of the script is impressive. the only negative is that it is way too long and drags on to much

"Now You See Me " was a very good movie , a little loose but scenes of magic, are magnificent , including those of action , a great work of the cast, including Isla Fisher is beautiful as always, and finally a good movie , good scenes and good work of the cast.
This is a magically movie and one of my favorites movies of this genre. When I saw this movie I found an excellent job both script and each of the characters

Now You See Me may be a bit light on substance, but it's still stylish and well-acted enough to entertain. The cast were all excellent, bringing plenty of energy to the movie and making the most out of an interesting premise. The magic tricks performed, while not always entirely plausible, were fun to watch as well. Some may find it too slick and twisty, but if you're looking for a fun, entertaining caper flick, this should satisfy you. Overall, a fun movie with enough tricks up its sleeve to make up for its flaws.
I didn't catch on until the near ending the major twist, so that made it good.
Entertaining and fast-paced with some fun tricks and illusions. I absolutely enjoyed this film. Although some of the "twists" couldn't fool me, I still liked it.
Like a real magic show, Now You See Me is thoroughly entertaining for the most part, but is ultimately silly and substanceless.
Now You See Me has great expectations, but it also has a stale mystery, it lacks a lot of thrill to it too, and the magic is sorta predictable after the first hour passes.
I really, really enjoyed watching this movie, but I was a bit sceptical at first.
WHAT I LIKED: It's fast paced, luxurious and well-scored cinema that offers bags of mystery and smiles. The characters are brought to life well with great acting, too. It's just indulgent and fun.

"Now you see me" es una de la películas policiales más originales que vi, no es una obra maestra pero ejecuta muy buenas ideas, giros argumentales y bastante acción que entretienen y termina siendo una buena película.

Paper-thin characters introduced like a sports team line-up, all full of themselves and spewing "bad-ass" lines trying way too hard to sound cool, like they were written by a teenager or something. Halfway through the movie the explanation to the "big mystery" is spelled out to us in every detail by Morgan Freeman, who did himself a big disservice by playing in this crap, and then all interest in continuing to watch the movie completely dies. At which point I press pause, get out of full-screen and close the player. The End.

This movie is a 10 in my book for its subversive commentary on media as a social tool. Which sociologically speaking, is one of the five forces that shape human society.  Here is the key that many people need to unlock those locks. If you take magic in the movie as an allegory for illusions that shapes social consciousness, the movie will make more sense than the simple heist everyone thinks this movie is.  The main point of the heist was not to steal the money, but to show the true face of their "benefactor" for his wrong doings. Their "benefactor" used media to make his crimes disappear through shaping social mindsets, much like magicians do a rabbit in a hat. This is a commentary on how there are many more stories of "good, wealthy" men (business, political, religious) who have used media (art, print, song, rumour) to make themselves appear to be something they are not, much like an illusion. Our history is littered with them, much like the many locks at the bottom of the water we see at the end of the movie. The key is to realize that men lie, create illusions of truthfulness, to remain in power. We, have the key to see through said illusions. Don't always trust the news, or rumours, or even leaders. Sometimes they are illusions, just as elaborate as a magic show.

Now You See Me is a very interesting movie that held my interest closely throughout. The way their magic tricks were planned and portrayed kept the film entertaining throughout. Definitely a really cool movie I recommend checking out.

This movie was an utter disappointment for me. The plots were not properly executed, there were many loopholes and the story was boring to be honest. The problem with these commercial films is that their whole purpose is to make money out of amateur movie goers rather than make something that should critically make sense.
